greed.question: Have I made accumulation of possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make my accumulation of money and possessions a driving force in my life, potentially leading me to prioritize material wealth over what truly matters?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted your blessings in life, forgetting to acknowledge their source as God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted your accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I had feelings of discontent when others achieve success, and secretly wished they would lose their accomplishments?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others in social settings, using language that was unworthy of my dignity or theirs?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking to others using language that was unbecoming of a Christian
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in speaking to others using language that was unbecoming of a Christian, causing them harm or offending their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others using language that was impolite or unbecoming in social settings?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: beyond what is reasonable for your physical needs
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking, possibly during social gatherings, meals with friends, or at home, beyond what is reasonable for your physical needs?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating and drinking to become a habit
gluttony.question: Did I allow excess in eating and drinking to become a habit, leading me away from moderation?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked my financial resources, compromising my ability to meet my family's needs and long-term obligations?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively prioritized recreational spending over meeting my financial responsibilities?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
through conversations at work or with friends and acquaintances
at work or with friends and acquaintances
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations at work or with friends and acquaintances?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
in conversations with close friends or colleagues
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, and especially when engaging in conversations with close friends or colleagues?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
through conversations at social gatherings or online forums
at social gatherings or online forums
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations at social gatherings or online forums?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Have I used my time and resources on a Sunday, even when it was unnecessary to do so?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
